segment.source: Initialize-FirmwareSubmission cmdlet
segment.target: Initialize-FirmwareSubmission cmdlet

segment.source: Initialize-FirmwareSubmission cmdlet
segment.target: Initialize-FirmwareSubmission cmdlet

segment.source: Initialize-FirmwareSubmission cmdlet
segment.target: Initialize-FirmwareSubmission cmdlet

segment.source: Use this standalone cmdlet to prepare a firmware submission.
segment.target: Use this standalone cmdlet to prepare a firmware submission.

segment.source: This cmdlet combines the firmware submission into a zip file on the local computer, and does not communicate with partner services.
segment.target: This cmdlet combines the firmware submission into a zip file on the local computer, and does not communicate with partner services.

segment.source: After using this cmdlet, use New-FirmwareSubmission cmdlet to upload the zip file that contains the firmware submission.
segment.target: After using this cmdlet, use New-FirmwareSubmission cmdlet to upload the zip file that contains the firmware submission.

segment.source: This cmdlet provides only a .NET file object as an output.
segment.target: This cmdlet provides only a .NET file object as an output.

segment.source: To submit the zip file that is created from this cmdlet, use the New-FirmwareSubmission cmdlet.
segment.target: To submit the zip file that is created from this cmdlet, use the New-FirmwareSubmission cmdlet.

segment.source: Prerequisites
segment.target: Prerequisites

segment.source: Create a package using ImgGen.cmd.
segment.target: Create a package using ImgGen.cmd.

segment.source: This creates multiple files, including an UpdateHistory.xml file and a targeting package file, which is named using the following format where OEM is the name of the OEM and Device is the name of the device:
segment.target: This creates multiple files, including an UpdateHistory.xml file and a targeting package file, which is named using the following format where OEM is the name of the OEM and Device is the name of the device:

segment.source: OEM.Device.Customizations.MainOS.spkg
segment.target: OEM.Device.Customizations.MainOS.spkg

segment.source: To use the same image for multiple OEMs or devices, add a targeting file (PhoneMetadataDeviceTargetingInfo.xml).
segment.target: To use the same image for multiple OEMs or devices, add a targeting file (PhoneMetadataDeviceTargetingInfo.xml).

segment.source: For more info, see DeviceInfo.
segment.target: For more info, see DeviceInfo.

segment.source: Parameters
segment.target: Parameters

segment.source: The following are the input parameters for this cmdlet.
segment.target: The following are the input parameters for this cmdlet.

segment.source: -UpdateHistoryPath (required)
segment.target: -UpdateHistoryPath (required)

segment.source: A string path to the UpdateHistory file.
segment.target: A string path to the UpdateHistory file.

segment.source: -OemInputPath (required)
segment.target: -OemInputPath (required)

segment.source: A string path to the OEMInput.xml file.
segment.target: A string path to the OEMInput.xml file.

segment.source: -TypeOfSubmission (required)
segment.target: -TypeOfSubmission (required)

segment.source: The submission type.
segment.target: The submission type.

segment.source: The type must be Image, FfuCatalog, or PartialImage.
segment.target: The type must be Image, FfuCatalog, or PartialImage.

segment.source: -OutputFilePath (required)
segment.target: -OutputFilePath (required)

segment.source: A string path to the resulting output zip file.
segment.target: A string path to the resulting output zip file.

segment.source: If this parameter does not contain a full path, the output file is saved in the current working directory.
segment.target: If this parameter does not contain a full path, the output file is saved in the current working directory.

segment.source: -TypeOfProduct
segment.target: -TypeOfProduct

segment.source: An optional parameter that specifies the target product of the firmware submission.
segment.target: An optional parameter that specifies the target product of the firmware submission.

segment.source: The product must be one of WindowsPhoneBlue, WindowsPhoneThreshold and WindowsIoTCoreThreshold.
segment.target: The product must be one of WindowsPhoneBlue, WindowsPhoneThreshold and WindowsIoTCoreThreshold.

segment.source: Default is WindowsPhoneBlue.
segment.target: Default is WindowsPhoneBlue.

segment.source: Note Product values may be added or removed periodically.
segment.target: Note Product values may be added or removed periodically.

segment.source: -SignedRemovalPackageFolder
segment.target: -SignedRemovalPackageFolder

segment.source: A string path to a folder that contains removal packages (with file extensions ending in .spkr) to be added to an image.
segment.target: A string path to a folder that contains removal packages (with file extensions ending in .spkr) to be added to an image.

segment.source: -PackagesToRemoveFolder
segment.target: -PackagesToRemoveFolder

segment.source: A string path to a folder that contains packages (with file extensions ending in .spkg) that will be used to generate removal packages to the image.
segment.target: A string path to a folder that contains packages (with file extensions ending in .spkg) that will be used to generate removal packages to the image.

segment.source: -Baseline
segment.target: -Baseline

segment.source: Declare a firmware submission to be a baseline so it can be used for retail servicing (via Request for Update (RFU)).
segment.target: Declare a firmware submission to be a baseline so it can be used for retail servicing (via Request for Update (RFU)).

segment.source: Baseline submissions must be Windows Standard Package Configuration compliant.
segment.target: Baseline submissions must be Windows Standard Package Configuration compliant.

segment.source: For more info, see Windows Standard Packaging Configuration (WSPC) requirements for retail images.
segment.target: For more info, see Windows Standard Packaging Configuration (WSPC) requirements for retail images.

segment.source: This flag cannot be used with –TypeOfSubmission FfuCatalog or –TypeOfSubmission PartialImage.
segment.target: This flag cannot be used with –TypeOfSubmission FfuCatalog or –TypeOfSubmission PartialImage.

segment.source: Also, this flag cannot be used with –SignedRemovalPackageFolder or –PackagesToRemoveFolder.
segment.target: Also, this flag cannot be used with –SignedRemovalPackageFolder or –PackagesToRemoveFolder.

segment.source: -NonWspcCompliant
segment.target: -NonWspcCompliant

segment.source: This parameter is deprecated.
segment.target: This parameter is deprecated.

segment.source: It was originally used to indicate that the submission was meant not to be compliant with the Windows Phone Standard Package Configuration (WSPC).
segment.target: It was originally used to indicate that the submission was meant not to be compliant with the Windows Phone Standard Package Configuration (WSPC).

segment.source: The WSPC model has changed and this flag is no longer used.
segment.target: The WSPC model has changed and this flag is no longer used.

segment.source: For more info about WSPC requirements, see Windows Standard Packaging Configuration (WSPC) requirements for retail images.
segment.target: For more info about WSPC requirements, see Windows Standard Packaging Configuration (WSPC) requirements for retail images.

segment.source: -FfuPath
segment.target: -FfuPath

segment.source: Full path to a FFU file that contains the FFU catalog to be submitted to be signed.
segment.target: Full path to a FFU file that contains the FFU catalog to be submitted to be signed.

segment.source: Include this parameter when specifying –TypeOfSubmission FfuCatalog.
segment.target: Include this parameter when specifying –TypeOfSubmission FfuCatalog.

segment.source: -PartialImageDirectory
segment.target: -PartialImageDirectory

segment.source: Full path to a directory that contains a partial image that consists only of SPKG files.
segment.target: Full path to a directory that contains a partial image that consists only of SPKG files.

segment.source: Include this parameter when specifying –TypeOfSubmission PartialImage.
segment.target: Include this parameter when specifying –TypeOfSubmission PartialImage.

segment.source: Sample Windows PowerShell scripts
segment.target: Sample Windows PowerShell scripts

segment.source: The following Windows PowerShell script can be used to submit a FFU catalog to be signed.
segment.target: The following Windows PowerShell script can be used to submit a FFU catalog to be signed.

segment.source: The following Windows PowerShell script can be used to submit a partial image to be signed.
segment.target: The following Windows PowerShell script can be used to submit a partial image to be signed.

segment.source: The following Windows PowerShell script can be used to read validation errors in the output pipeline of this cmdlet, where path is replaced with the respective absolute file path.
segment.target: The following Windows PowerShell script can be used to read validation errors in the output pipeline of this cmdlet, where path is replaced with the respective absolute file path.

segment.source: Errors
segment.target: Errors

segment.source: If the submission zip isn’t constructed properly, this Windows Powershell cmdlet returns an empty string.
segment.target: If the submission zip isn’t constructed properly, this Windows Powershell cmdlet returns an empty string.

segment.source: If the submission zip is constructed but there were validation errors, these errors are captured in the error log in the submission zip.
segment.target: If the submission zip is constructed but there were validation errors, these errors are captured in the error log in the submission zip.

segment.source: In Windows Phone 8.1, a targeting package was required (OEM.Device.Customizations.MainOS.spkg).
segment.target: In Windows Phone 8.1, a targeting package was required (OEM.Device.Customizations.MainOS.spkg).

segment.source: If this package isn’t included, an exception will be thrown.
segment.target: If this package isn’t included, an exception will be thrown.

segment.target: Help documentation from Windows PowerShell

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Windows Standard Packaging Configuration (WSPC) requirements for retail images

segment.source: New-FirmwareSubmission cmdlet
segment.target: New-FirmwareSubmission cmdlet
